availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Cynthia Duncan. Father of Charles Duncan. Owned one enslaved person in Pendleton County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 357A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 449.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 126.
Find A Grave, "Hansford Duncan (October 6, 1806-September 5, 1874)," Memorial #60950049, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60950049 (accessed June 6, 2018).
